routing.mileSystem: Continuous northbound mileage from Springer Mtn to Big Creek
routing.sectioning: Official BMTA sections (small lettered segments by trail junctions/road crossings)
routing.routeVariantPolicy: No official alternate routes – single primary route

sources.name: Benton MacKaye Trail Association (BMTA)
sources.description: Managing organization and official trail information

sections.name: Springer Mountain to Big Stamp Gap

difficulty.description: Moderate climb from Springer summit down to gap

sections.name: Big Stamp Gap to 2nd Cross Trails

difficulty.description: Rolling terrain with AT junctions

sections.name: 2nd Cross Trails to Three Forks

difficulty.description: Moderate descent to Three Forks (water junction)

sections.name: Three Forks to No Name Gap

difficulty.description: Steady climb into remote area

sections.name: No Name Gap to Bryson Gap

difficulty.description: Ridge hiking with minor ups and downs

sections.name: Bryson Gap to Toccoa River

difficulty.description: Descent to river valley; scenic bridge crossing

sections.name: Toccoa River to GA Hwy 60 (Little Skeenah)

difficulty.description: Climb from river to highway crossing

sections.name: GA 60 (Little Skeenah) to Wallalah-Licklog Saddle

difficulty.description: Steep climb into ridge saddle

sections.name: Wallalah-Licklog Saddle to Licklog-Rhodes Saddle

difficulty.description: Short ridge walk between saddles

sections.name: Licklog-Rhodes Saddle to Skeenah Gap

difficulty.description: Descent to Skeenah Gap Road

sections.name: Skeenah Gap to Payne Gap

difficulty.description: Climb from gap into foothills

sections.name: Payne Gap to Wilscot Gap (GA Hwy 60)

difficulty.description: Ridge hike then descent to Wilscot Gap road

sections.name: Wilscot Gap (GA 60) to Ledford Gap

difficulty.description: Steep ascent from highway into remote gap

sections.name: Ledford Gap to Brawley Mountain

difficulty.description: Short climb to Brawley Mountain summit

sections.name: Brawley Mountain to Dial Road

difficulty.description: Steep downhill from Brawley Mtn to Dial Road

sections.name: Dial Road to Shallowford Bridge

difficulty.description: Easy road and riverside walk to Shallowford Bridge

sections.name: Shallowford Bridge to Fall Branch (Stanley Creek Road)

difficulty.description: Uphill into Rich Mtn Wilderness, ending at falls trail

sections.name: Fall Branch to Stanley Gap Trail Junction

difficulty.description: Short steep climb to Stanley Gap Trail crossing

sections.name: Stanley Gap Trail to Rich Mountain (old trail)

end.name: Rich Mountain (old Rich Mtn Trail area)

difficulty.description: Remote ridge traverse over Rich Mountain

sections.name: Stanley Gap Trail to Weaver/Laurel Creek Road

difficulty.description: Descent out of wilderness to gravel road

sections.name: Weaver/Laurel Creek Road to GA Hwy 515

difficulty.description: Easy trail and roadwalk approaching Highway 515

sections.name: GA 515 to Sisson’s Shelter spur

difficulty.description: Gentle climb toward shelter area

sections.name: Sisson’s Shelter to Boardtown Road

difficulty.description: Rolling terrain through foothills to road

sections.name: Boardtown Road to Bushy Head Gap

difficulty.description: Steady climb and descent in wooded terrain

sections.name: Bushy Head Gap to Hudson Gap

difficulty.description: Rugged climb towards Cohutta foothills

sections.name: Hudson Gap to McKenney Gap

difficulty.description: Short but steep segment along ridgeline

sections.name: McKenney Gap to Hatley Gap

difficulty.description: Rugged and remote ridge section

sections.name: Hatley Gap to Fowler Mountain

difficulty.description: Steep ascent onto Fowler Mountain ridge

sections.name: Fowler Mountain to Holloway Gap

difficulty.description: Rolling ridge walk with minor descent

sections.name: Holloway Gap to Double Hogpen Gap

difficulty.description: Short traverse through remote forest

sections.name: Double Hogpen Gap to Flat Top Mountain

difficulty.description: Steep climb to near 3700 ft on Flat Top Mtn (GA’s 2nd highest BMT point)

sections.name: Flat Top Mountain to Dyer Gap

difficulty.description: Descent to Dyer Gap trailhead on FS road

sections.name: Dyer Gap to Pinhoti Trail Intersection (South Fork)

difficulty.description: Northwest turn at state line, meeting Pinhoti connector trail

sections.name: Pinhoti Intersection to Pate Gap

difficulty.description: Moderate trail through wooded gap

sections.name: Pate Gap to Watson Gap

difficulty.description: Short connector to Watson Gap road

sections.name: Watson Gap to Jacks River Trail (Dally Gap)

difficulty.description: Entering Cohutta Wilderness; moderate trail to Jacks River Jct

sections.name: Jacks River Trail to Hemp Top Trail

difficulty.description: Steady uphill on Hemp Top ridge

sections.name: Hemp Top Trail to Hemp Top (Peak)

difficulty.description: Strenuous climb to Hemp Top (4,000+ ft elevation)

sections.name: Hemp Top to Double Spring Gap

difficulty.description: Gentle ridgeline to Double Spring Gap on GA/TN line

sections.name: Double Spring Gap to Big Frog Mountain

difficulty.description: Steep climb to Big Frog Mountain (4,224 ft summit)

sections.name: Big Frog Mountain to Fork Ridge Trail Jct

difficulty.description: Ridge descent from summit to trail junction

sections.name: Fork Ridge Trail to Rough Creek Trail Jct

difficulty.description: Wilderness ridge traverse to Rough Creek Trail

sections.name: Rough Creek Trail to USFS Road 221

difficulty.description: Descent out of wilderness to FS221 trailhead

sections.name: USFS 221 to US Hwy 64 (Ocoee River)

difficulty.description: Easy trail to Ocoee River valley and highway crossing

sections.name: US 64 (Ocoee) to Dry Pond Lead High Point

start.name: US 64 at Thunder Rock / Ocoee Whitewater Center

end.name: Dry Pond Lead highpoint (Oswald Dome area)

difficulty.description: Long climb from Ocoee River to ridgeline

sections.name: Dry Pond Lead to Kimsey Highway (FS 68)

difficulty.description: Ridgetop trail to forest road crossing

sections.name: Kimsey Highway to McFarland Road (FS 23)

difficulty.description: Forest trail with moderate ups and downs

sections.name: McFarland Road to White Oak Flats (FS 103)

end.name: White Oak Flats Rd (Lost Creek CG)

difficulty.description: Winding trail along Lost Creek to campground

sections.name: White Oak Flats (Lost Creek) to FS 173 (Trestle)

difficulty.description: Level riverside trail along Hiwassee to old railroad trestle

sections.name: Trestle (FS 173) to Childers Creek (John Muir Trail)

difficulty.description: Short connector to John Muir Trail along river

sections.name: Childers Creek (JMT) to Big Bend

difficulty.description: Flat riverside trail following John Muir Trail

sections.name: Big Bend to Towee Creek

difficulty.description: Level trail along Hiwassee to Towee Creek trailhead

sections.name: Towee Creek to Wildcat Creek

difficulty.description: Gradual climb away from river up Wildcat Creek valley

sections.name: Wildcat Creek to FS 22B (Coker Creek)

difficulty.description: Uphill to Coker Creek road crossing

sections.name: FS 22B (Coker Creek) to TN Hwy 68 (Unicoi Mountain Trail)

difficulty.description: Remote climb over Unicoi Mtn to Hwy 68 gap

sections.name: TN 68 to Buck Bald Road

difficulty.description: Short forest segment crossing Buck Bald Rd

sections.name: Buck Bald Road to Unicoi Gap (TN/NC state line)

difficulty.description: Gradual climb and descent along state-line ridge

sections.name: Unicoi Gap to Tate Gap

difficulty.description: Strenuous section through upper Unicoi Mountains

sections.name: Tate Gap to Sixmile Gap

difficulty.description: Ridgetop hike between gaps

sections.name: Sixmile Gap to Sandy Gap

difficulty.description: Wooded ridge trail to Sandy Gap (Cherohala Skyway area)

sections.name: Sandy Gap to Round Top (TN/NC state line)

difficulty.description: Difficult, remote stretch along TN/NC state line

sections.name: Round Top to Sled Runner Gap

difficulty.description: Remote ridge trail continuing along state line

sections.name: Sled Runner Gap to Brookshire Creek crossing

difficulty.description: Challenging descent to Brookshire Creek (water crossing)

sections.name: Brookshire Creek to Sugar Mountain Road

difficulty.description: Creekside trail and climb to Sugar Mt. Rd

sections.name: Sugar Mountain Road to Tellico River Road (FS 210)

difficulty.description: Descent to paved Tellico River Road at Green Cove

sections.name: Tellico River Road (Green Cove) to Mangan Branch

difficulty.description: Uphill away from Tellico River into Mangan Branch area

sections.name: Mangan Branch to FS 61B (Sycamore Creek Trail)

difficulty.description: Long climb toward Whiggs Meadow area

sections.name: FS 61B (Sycamore Creek TH) to Mud Gap

difficulty.description: Moderate trail to Cherohala Skyway crossing at Mud Gap

sections.name: Mud Gap (Cherohala) to Beech Gap (Nantahala NF)

difficulty.description: Trail follows state line, ending at Beech Gap on Cherohala Skyway

sections.name: Beech Gap to Haoe Lead (Southwest) Intersection

difficulty.description: Very difficult, remote section entering Slickrock Wilderness

sections.name: Haoe Lead (SW) to Hangover Lead Trail Jct

difficulty.description: Extremely rugged terrain near Hangover Lead

sections.name: Haoe Lead (Northeast) to Big Fat Gap

difficulty.description: Notoriously challenging descent to Big Fat Gap

sections.name: Big Fat Gap to Yellowhammer Gap

difficulty.description: Strenuous climb from Big Fat Gap towards Yellowhammer

sections.name: Yellowhammer Gap to Tapoco Lodge (US 129)

difficulty.description: Descent to Cheoah River and historic Tapoco Lodge

sections.name: Tapoco Lodge (US 129) to Old Field Gap Road

difficulty.description: Steep climb from Cheoah River to Old Field Gap

sections.name: Old Field Gap Road to FS 251C (Fontana East)

difficulty.description: Moderate trail skirting south of Fontana Lake

sections.name: FS 251C to Fontana Lodge

difficulty.description: Rolling trail above Fontana Lake to village resort

sections.name: Fontana Lodge to AT Intersection (Fontana Hilton)

difficulty.description: Easy lakeshore walk to rejoin Appalachian Trail near Fontana Dam

sections.name: AT Intersection to Fontana Dam (Northern Terminus)

difficulty.description: Paved path across Fontana Dam to enter Great Smoky Mountains NP

sections.name: Fontana Dam to Eagle Creek Trail (Lakeshore Trail)

difficulty.description: Rolling lakeside trail into the Smokies (BMT-S starts)

sections.name: Eagle Creek Trail to Campsite 86 (Hazel Creek)

difficulty.description: Lakeshore Trail continues to Hazel Creek backcountry site

sections.name: Campsite 86 to Campsite 77 (Hazel–Forney)

difficulty.description: Long lakeshore trek past Hazel Creek to Forney Creek

sections.name: Campsite 77 to Campsite 98 (Lakeshore–Forney)

difficulty.description: Lakeshore Trail undulates with moderate difficulty

sections.name: Campsite 98 to Campsite 74 (Lakeshore Trail)

difficulty.description: Moderate lakeside trail with gentle grades

sections.name: Campsite 74 to Noland Creek Trail Junction

difficulty.description: Lakeshore Trail to Noland Creek with minor elevation changes

sections.name: Noland Creek Trail to Noland Divide Trail Junction

difficulty.description: Long secluded stretch on Sunkota Ridge with moderate grade

sections.name: Noland Divide Trail to Deep Creek Trail (Mingus Creek/MST)

difficulty.description: Transition from Sunkota Ridge to Deep Creek watershed

sections.name: Deep Creek Trail / MST to Campsite 52

difficulty.description: Gentle descent along Deep Creek to backcountry campsite

sections.name: Campsite 52 (Deep Creek) to Smokemont Campground

difficulty.description: Climb out of Deep Creek watershed to Smokemont on US-441

sections.name: Smokemont Campground to Campsite 47 (Enloe Creek)

difficulty.description: Long climb up Bradley Fork and Enloe Creek to high country

sections.name: Campsite 47 (Enloe) to Straight Fork Road

difficulty.description: Downhill along Hyatt Ridge to Straight Fork Rd

sections.name: Straight Fork Road to Laurel Gap Shelter

difficulty.description: Steep ascent onto Balsam Mountain to Laurel Gap shelter

sections.name: Laurel Gap Shelter to Big Creek (Northern Terminus)

difficulty.description: Climb to Mt. Sterling (5843′, trail’s highest) then long descent to Big Creek
